io.cettia.transport

Interface ServerTransport

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseServerTransport

    public interface ServerTransport
    Represents a server-side full duplex message channel ensuring there is no message loss and no idle connection.

    Implementations are thread safe.

    Author:
    Donghwan Kim

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes the connection.
      ServerTransport onbinary(Action<ByteBuffer> action)
      Attaches an action for the binary message.
      ServerTransport onclose(Action<Void> action)
      Attaches an action for the close event.
      ServerTransport onerror(Action<Throwable> action)
      Executed if there was any error on the connection.
      ServerTransport ontext(Action<String> action)
      Attaches an action for the text message.
      ServerTransport send(ByteBuffer data)
      Sends a binary message through the connection.
      ServerTransport send(String data)
      Sends a text message through the connection.
      <T> T unwrap(Class<T> clazz)
      Returns the underlying component.
      String uri()
      A URI used to connect.

    • Method Detail

      • uri

        String uri()
        A URI used to connect. To work with URI parts, use URI or something like that.

      • onerror

        ServerTransport onerror(Action<Throwable> action)
        Executed if there was any error on the connection. You don't need to close it explicitly.

      • ontext

        ServerTransport ontext(Action<String> action)
        Attaches an action for the text message.

      • onbinary

        ServerTransport onbinary(Action<ByteBuffer> action)
        Attaches an action for the binary message.

      • send

        ServerTransport send(String data)
        Sends a text message through the connection.

      • send

        ServerTransport send(ByteBuffer data)
        Sends a binary message through the connection.

      • onclose

        ServerTransport onclose(Action<Void> action)
        Attaches an action for the close event. After this event, the instance shouldn't be used and all the other events will be disabled.

      • close

        void close()
        Closes the connection. This method has no side effect if called more than once.

      • unwrap

        <T> T unwrap(Class<T> clazz)
        Returns the underlying component.
